properties.name: Boomerangs
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc716 Centre St, Jamaica Plain, 02130This is one of my favorite thrift stores. I can almost always find something good here, and it\'s always dirt cheap. I\'ve gotten like five J. Crew sweaters here--I think there\'s some JP lady who goes through J. Crew sweaters like paper towels and just dumps them all here. You have good taste, lady.

properties.name: Boutique Fabulous
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1309 Cambridge Street, Cambridge, Massachusetts 02139One of the few (only?) stores left in Boston that offers good quality vintage/retro items at a reasonable price. ok, so maybe it is on the pricey side of reasonable but the owner obviously has a great eye for the old and new.

properties.name: Café Society
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc131 Cypress St Brookline maIf you really want the vintage advantage, you have to visit Café Society. Handbags, hatboxes, bellbottoms, and butterfly collars are just some of their ever-rotating retro inventory.

properties.name: Chery's NY Gear
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc287 Salem St., malden, ma

properties.name: Closet Upstairs
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc223 Newbury St, Boston, MAInstead of spending your next paycheck at Banana Republic, revamp your wardrobe with authentic retro chic.

properties.name: Discovery Shop of the American Cancer Society
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc  308 Walnut St, newton, maThis is a well-kept secret. Local merchants donate new items here, I\'ve found Anthropologie clothes in mint condition (new with tags). The used clothes are great. An amazing selection of sleeveless black dresses lives here, who knows why.

properties.name: Encore Exchange
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc318 Harvard St., brookline, maThis idiosyncratic secondhand store is the last bastion of vintage in Coolidge Corner, according to the owner, a fabulous woman in her 60s who has been operating her shop for over 40 years with the help of her equally fabulous husband and Yorkie terrier, Dutchess.

properties.name: Frida Bee
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1297 Cambridge Street , cambridge, maIt is a consignment, thrift store. The owner is extremely nice and the items are priced well. The only downside is that there are hardly any men\'s clothes. The majority of stuff is children\'s clothes. Would like to see more women\'s and vintage clothing. You can bring in your stuff for trade or cash. Highly recommended! Check it out and find some treasures!

properties.name: Garment District
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc200 Broadway, Cambridge, MACampy Cambridge warehouse sells funky secondhand clothes, including lots of retro outfits and accessories. Dollar a pound!

properties.name: Goodwill
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 1010 HARRISON AVE, boston, mathe goodwill... (near melina cass blvd) is where all the loaded south end ladies unload their chanel and prada stuff!

properties.name: Goodwill
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 520 MASSACHUSETTS AVE, cambridge, ma

properties.name: Goodwill
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc470 W BROADWAY 02127

properties.name: Goodwill
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc230 Elm St, Somerville, MA 02144

properties.name: Great Eastern Trading Company
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc49 River St., cambridge, maIf you\'re a fan of the wilder, funkier side of Garment District you\'ll love this place. They\'ve got great vintage, costumes, accessories and jewelry. Items are in generally good condition, prices reasonable and the owner (?) is quirky and fun.

properties.name: Gumshoe
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc40 South St., Jamaica Plain, maGeek chic! It’s still all the rage for indie guys, and if it’s your thing, nerdo, you’ll enjoy the cowboy shirts, old sports-tees and ceiling-high stack of cords and jeans here. It’s a little hard to get to, but they offer clothes that are even harder to get.

properties.name: H&M
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc350 Washington St., Boston

properties.name: Hadassah Bargain Spot
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1123 Commonwealth Ave, boston, maI absolutely LOVE this place. The owner is soooooooo incredibly nice always joking and in a god mood and you can find some really good bargains. Plus you can donate any stuff you want. Don\'t pay any attention to what the actual prices are, if you buy more than two items, the owner (can\'t remember his name) just gives you a price, which is usually lower than the added totals.

properties.name: History
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1693 Massachusetts Ave, cambridge, maWith racks of clothing organized by decade and loads of vintage t-shirts, History has clothing for everyone. Although most of the clothing is used (as implied by the name) there are some new clothes as well. The store is reasonably priced, well located and is run by a wonderful woman named Rachel who will answer any of your questions.

properties.name: Le Bon Marche
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc10 Arrow Street, Cambridge, MASome of the top picks for accessories here include 1920’s vintage style retro necklaces and unique evening bags. While some of the clothes here are a bit, ahem, “old ladyfish”, it’s a gold mine for lovers of interesting and tasteful accessories. If you search the clothes on the racks carefully, you might find a gorgeous vintage number.

properties.name: Malden Center Thrift Store
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc88 Pleasant St, Malden, MAtwo stores off the orange line. They pay cash! Why donate. Their jewelry section is the best in the world, real or fake. kinda ghetto.

properties.name: Manhattan Clothing II
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc40 Winter St, boston, ma

properties.name: Oona's
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1210 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MAHarvard Square vintage clothing shop specializes in pre-\'80s items.

properties.name: Poor Little Rich Girl
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc255 Elm St., Somerville, maDon’t let the name deceive you. This Davis Square den of discard could be called “Rich Little Poor Girl” for the variety of secondhand women’s wear at dirt cheap prices.

properties.name: Porch
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc23 Mystic St., arlington, ma

properties.name: Proletariat
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc36 JFK St, cambridge, maProletariot is one of my favorite stores in Boston. They carry some of the illest t-shirts I have ever seen, all designed in house. The vintage stuff is pretty high quality, too. They also have other hard to find stuff for sale, such as graffiti markers, Montana paints, a good range of paint caps, skateboards and accessories, and graffiti art on canvas for sale. Everyone who works there is chilled out as hell and the music is always something good.

properties.name: Reddog Vintage Clothing
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1076 Cambridge St., Cambridge, ma

properties.name: Second Time Around
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc99 Charles St., boston, ma This is branch of Second Time Around has a different feel than the Newbury St. stores - just by not being on Newbury it\'s not as crowded (most of the time), which makes the laborious process of digging through consignment a little easier. They get some really great stuff, and the turnover is pretty quick - I\'d go away for the weekend and when I came back there would be piles of new clothes.

properties.name: Second Time Around (Boston)
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc176 Newbury Street, boston, maCan you say upscale? This boutique has the hottest of labels- Seven, Christian Dior, Chaiken, Diesel, Ferragamo and more. This isn’t the place to go if you’re looking for cheap, unique thrift store clothes- most of the items here still cost a good chunk of change. But here you can pay a lot of money for designer, instead of ridiculous money for designer.

properties.name: Second Time Around (Cambridge)
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc8 Eliot Street, cambridge, maCan you say upscale? This boutique has the hottest of labels- Seven, Christian Dior, Chaiken, Diesel, Ferragamo and more. This isn’t the place to go if you’re looking for cheap, unique thrift store clothes- most of the items here still cost a good chunk of change. But here you can pay a lot of money for designer, instead of ridiculous money for designer.

properties.name: Something Extra
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc474 Massachusetts Avenue

properties.name: The Closet
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc175 Newbury St., boston, maI really love this place..... whether I\'m selling or buying. It is a bit cramped and cluttered and you certainly have to search ...but if you have patience and a good eye...oh the -secret-fabulous-finds will you locate!

properties.name: The Finer Consigner
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc53 langley rd., newton, maThe people who work here are very aloof. The accessories are my favorite part- lots of Chanel, Balenciaga, Louis Vuitton...the works. GREAT FOR: bags, costume jewelry, shoes.

properties.name: Transitions Thrift Store
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1738 Washington St, Boston, MA

properties.name: Urban Renewals
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc122 Brighton Ave., allston, maIf you don\'t like picking through racks and racks of clothing in a HUGE wherehouse style building, this place is not for you! BUT -- its Bostons cheap Vintage shopping at its BEST. Like an earlier review said -- its great for wacky, ugly and stupid costumes, but also great for real clothes!

properties.name: WARREN TOWERS
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc700 commonwealth ave., boston, ma

properties.name: Zia Clothing Outlet
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc91 Trapelo Rd, belmont, maZia is a cute little local shop that houses a decent collection of new and used women\'s separates. Everything seems pretty cheap, so while I\'ve never found anything I wanted, it\'s fun to browse. Best for accessories, sometimes for shoes. It\'s one of those shops that spans generations, clothing-wise, so you\'ll have to pick through the layers of age, but I mean that in a good way. Friendly service, never pushy.
